title: SauceBot could revolutionise the humble Bunnings sausage sizzle
text:
A new machine could revolutionise the traditional Bunnings sausage sizzle, applying sauce in perfect proportions to ensure the ideal lunchtime snack.

SauceBot was created by a group of 'hackers' in Melbourne, who meet regularly to experiment with robotics.

The robot 3D-prints sauce on to the sausage, appearing to use a squiggly line for tomato and a straight line for mustard.

A new machine could revolutionise the traditional Bunnings sausage sizzle, applying sauce in perfect proportions to ensure the ideal lunchtime snack

Each is controlled by a large red or yellow button, and a moving tray holds the sausage in place while the machine works its magic.

The clever invention was seen during a recent Bunnings sausage sizzle to raise money for the 'hackerspace', located in Hawthorn.

Shoppers were seen gathered around the stand, watching the machine at work.

A video showing the robot hard at work was shared to Reddit on Sunday, exclaiming: 'SauceBot takes Bunnings sausage sizzles to the next level'.

Users were astounded by the creation, with one remarking: 'What is this magic?'

Another joked: 'It's good to see Bunnings R&D money has been well spent.'

And while many marvelled at the science, others were more concerned about the safety precautions being taken during the fundraiser.

'But where are the onions going,' one user asked. 'Top or bottom?'
description: A new machine is revolutionising the traditional Bunnings sausage sizzle, applying sauce in perfect proportions to ensure the ideal lunchtime snack.
